subject: Cybersecurity
title: AES: The Encryption Standard You Use Every Day
description: A fast breakdown of AES: The Encryption Standard You Use Every Day for builders.

hook.text: Every time you use HTTPS, Wi-Fi, or a VPN, a Belgian algorithm protects your data.

buildup.text: AES won a public global competition in 2001. It was designed by two Belgian cryptographers: Rijmen and Daemen.

discovery.text: AES uses 128, 192, or 256-bit keys. A 128-bit key has more possible values than atoms in the universe.

twist.text: Unlike DES, AES was chosen through open competition. Anyone could try to break it. No one succeeded.

climax.text: AES is so efficient that modern CPUs have dedicated hardware instructions just for running it.

punchline.text: The world's encryption standard was designed by two Belgians.

quiz.question: How was AES selected as the encryption standard?
